title: Teaching team
text:
Teaching staff welcome communication from students. We aim to respond to emails within two working days. Our email addresses are below. Please follow the basics of Netiquette and the Student Code of Conduct.
You can reach us via email, or you can reach us at our office location, which is on the first floor of the Admin building:

title: MC3010 - Differential Equations and Numerical Methods - E22
text: Welcome to Differential Equations and Numerical Methods!

title: MC3010 - Differential Equations and Numerical Methods - E22
text:
Course Overview:
This course covers Introduction, Higher Order Linear Differential Equations, Laplace Transformation, Surfaces and Curvilinear Coordinates and Multiple Integrals, Numerical Errors, Roots of Equations and System of Linear Equations, Numerical Integration and Differentiation, Numerical Solution of Ordinary Differential Equations.

title: MC3010 - Differential Equations and Numerical Methods - E22
text:
Expected outcomes:
By the end of the course, the student should be able to Discuss the concepts of differential equations, and Multivariable calculus; Compare and analyse the methods in differential equations and Multivariable calculus; Translate engineering problems in differential equations and Multivariable calculus and solve it; Apply appropriate numerical methods to solve engineering problems and implement it using suitable software.

title: MC3010 - Differential Equations and Numerical Methods - E22
text:
Evaluation:
The final letter grade for this course will be determined by each method of assessment weighted as follows:

In course assessments (50%)

Assignment (30%)
Mid-semester assessment (20%)

End of course examination (50%)

title: MC3010 - Differential Equations and Numerical Methods - E22
text:
Attendance Policy:
Regular attendance is a fundamental aspect of your success in this course. To maintain an engaged and collaborative learning environment, a minimum attendance rate of \(80\%\) is compulsory. Attendance will be recorded during each class session. If we find that your attendance percentage falls below the required threshold due to extenuating circumstances, you must seek approval from your academic adviser. This approval is mandatory for participation in any examinations, including assignments. It is essential to communicate proactively with your adviser to discuss the reasons for any attendance issues and to devise a plan for catching up on missed coursework. Please note that exceptions will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a strong emphasis on maintaining the integrity of the learning experience for all students.
